emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on ResQ Club app
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your mobile app is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: User email address enumeration vulnerability on ResQ Club app
emails.bodyHtml: Hello, During our research on user account enumeration flaws on Estonian online services, we found that your mobile app is vulnerable to the exposure of registered user email addresses. The vulnerability report is attached. We would appreciate it if you could confirm receipt of this email to prevent us from reaching out to you through other channels. Best regards, Gregor Eesmaa Computer Science MSc student University of Tartu, Institute of Computer Science

emails.subject: We are updating our privacy policy
emails.bodyHtml:
Hi,

We are updating our privacy policy to make it more easy for you to understand how we process your data. The updated privacy policy will come into effect on June 16, 2025.


Hereʼs what has changed:

  • We made it more clear what we process and what the legal basis is for the processing
  • We clarified how long we store the data for
  • We clarified the terminology of the service to also include other items than food
  • We included a section on profiling to make it possible to improve how we, e.g., recommend offers to you in the future


View our new Privacy Policy


If you have any questions about our privacy policy or how we handle your data, please contact us at privacy@resq-club.com


Best,

ResQ Club

 

You are receiving this message because there is a ResQ Club account associated with this email address.

2025 © ResQ Club

emails.subject: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega äpis ResQ Club / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on ResQ Club app
emails.bodyHtml:
Lugupeetud ResQ Club äpi vastutav andmetöötleja

Pöördun, et edastada ametlikult mure isikuandmete kaitse üldmääruse (IKÜM) alusel seoses minu isikuandmete töötlemisega äpis ResQ Club, mida pean ebaseaduslikuks ning mis võib viia nende avaldamiseni selleks volitamata isikutele ilma selge õigusliku aluseta.

Manuses on ametlik taotlus (samuti digiallkirjastatud kujul), milles teostan oma õigusi IKÜM artiklite 15, 18 ja 21 alusel. Palun selle läbivaatust ja vastavate meetmete võtmist ajaraamis, mis on sätestatud IKÜM artiklis 12(3) (üks kuu taotluse saamisest).

Palun teavitage taotluse kättesaamisest.

Lugupidamisega
Gregor Eesmaa

--

Dear Data Controller of ResQ Club app,

I am contacting you to formally raise concerns under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) regarding what I believe to be the unlawful processing of my personal data by ResQ Club app, potentially leading to its disclosure to unauthorised parties without a clear legal basis.

Please find attached a formal application (also in digitally signed form) exercising my rights under Articles 15, 18, and 21 of the GDPR. I request that you review and act upon it accordingly, within the timeframe established by Article 12(3) of the GDPR (one month from receipt).

Please confirm receipt of this request.

Kind regards,
Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Re: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega äpis ResQ Club / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on ResQ Club app
emails.bodyHtml:
Viitasin valesti vea ilmnemise kohad – viga esineb parooli lähtestamise vormil, kasutaja registreerimise vormil ja meiliaadressi vahetamise vormil. Parandatud taotlus manuses.

Lugupidamisega
Gregor Eesmaa

--

I mis-referenced vulnerable forms – the flaw is apparent in the password reset form, account registration form and email change form. Corrected request is attached.

Kind regards,
Gregor Eesmaa

emails.subject: Re: IKÜM taotlus seoses isikuandmete töötlemisega äpis ResQ Club / GDPR Request Regarding Processing of Personal Data on ResQ Club app
emails.bodyHtml:
Dear Gregor,

We have received and reviewed your report on June 21, 2025. Thank You for it and its exhaustiveness. We apologise for not responding to your initial contact. The email was incorrectly marked as spam, and your message had never reached us. Since then, we have improved our processes related to data and GDPR requests. From now on, such requests are less likely to be falsely marked as spam and receive the attention they deserve.

Once again, the report is greatly appreciated. It highlights the issues in our system and proposes mitigations as well. It is one of the most professional communications we have seen in quite a while, and it directly helps improve our platform. For this reason, as a token of our appreciation, we would like to offer you a ResQ credit code of 15 credits, RESQ-CQGRH (valid until August 31st).

We were not aware of these issues before this. We have registered them and created a plan on how to address and fix them. We will tackle these tasks as soon as possible; however, the Finnish summer holiday season may cause a delay. If you wish, we will keep you updated after we address each of the three reported issues.

Please let us know if you have any further questions or concerns.

Best Regards,
ResQ.

llmAnalysis.thinking:
## Analysis of GDPR Response Email

Here's a breakdown of the email analysis, following the requested steps:

**1. Discovering 1:** Initial quote extraction for each JSON field.

*   **extension_explicitly_requested:** "the Finnish summer holiday season may cause a delay." (Implies a potential need for more time, but doesn't explicitly request an extension.)
*   **extension_deadline:** Not explicitly mentioned.
*   **extension_reasons:** "Finnish summer holiday season"
*   **acknowledgement:** "We were not aware of these issues before this." and "It highlights the issues in our system" (Suggests agreement that there *are* issues.)
*   **justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points:** Not mentioned.
*   **justification_topics:** "account_management" (Implied by addressing issues in the system related to account enumeration.)
*   **remediation_status:** "We have registered them and created a plan on how to address and fix them." (Indicates remediation is *planned*.)
*   **remediation_scope:** Not mentioned.
*   **remediation_finish_date:** Not mentioned.

**2. Interpreting 1:** Initial interpretation of the email.

The email is primarily an acknowledgement of the report. The sender apologizes for the delayed response due to a spam filter issue and expresses gratitude for the detailed report. They admit they were unaware of the account enumeration vulnerability. They state they've created a plan to address the issues but mention potential delays due to the summer holiday season.  There's no explicit request for an extension, but the holiday season comment hints at a possible delay in fulfilling the one-month deadline. No legal basis for processing is mentioned, nor is there any discussion of restricting or ceasing processing. The remediation is planned, but the scope and completion date are unknown.

**3. Composing 1:** First draft JSON object.

```json
{
  "extension_explicitly_requested": false,
  "extension_deadline": null,
  "extension_reasons": ["holidays"],
  "acknowledgement": "agree",
  "justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points": null,
  "justification_topics": ["account_management"],
  "remediation_status": "planned",
  "remediation_scope": "unclear",
  "remediation_finish_date": null
}
```

**4. Discovering 2:** More detailed quote extraction.

*   **extension_explicitly_requested:**  Still no explicit request.
*   **extension_deadline:** Still not mentioned.
*   **extension_reasons:** "Finnish summer holiday season" - more specific.
*   **acknowledgement:** "We were not aware of these issues before this." - strong agreement.
*   **justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points:** Still absent.
*   **justification_topics:** "account_security" (Addressing a vulnerability implies concern for account security.)
*   **remediation_status:** "We have registered them and created a plan on how to address and fix them." - confirms planning.
*   **remediation_scope:** Still unclear.
*   **remediation_finish_date:** Still absent.
*   **Additional:** "We will tackle these tasks as soon as possible" - vague promise of action.

**5. Interpreting 2:** Improved interpretation.

The email remains largely an acknowledgement. The sender is clearly receptive to the report and apologetic for the delay. The lack of any mention of a legal basis for the processing is significant. The planned remediation is positive, but the "as soon as possible" phrasing is non-committal. The holiday season comment is a potential indicator of a delay, but doesn't constitute a formal extension request. The addition of "account_security" to the justification topics is relevant, as fixing an enumeration vulnerability directly improves security.

**6. Composing 2:** Second draft JSON object.

```json
{
  "extension_explicitly_requested": false,
  "extension_deadline": null,
  "extension_reasons": ["holidays"],
  "acknowledgement": "agree",
  "justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points": null,
  "justification_topics": ["account_management", "account_security"],
  "remediation_status": "planned",
  "remediation_scope": "unclear",
  "remediation_finish_date": null
}
```

**7. Discovering 3:** Even more detailed quote extraction.

*   **extension_explicitly_requested:** Still no explicit request.
*   **extension_deadline:** Still not mentioned.
*   **extension_reasons:** "Finnish summer holiday season"
*   **acknowledgement:** "It directly helps improve our platform." - reinforces agreement and positive reception.
*   **justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points:** Still absent.
*   **justification_topics:** None new.
*   **remediation_status:** "We will tackle these tasks as soon as possible" - reinforces planning, but is vague.
*   **remediation_scope:** Still unclear.
*   **remediation_finish_date:** Still absent.
*   **Additional:** "We will keep you updated after we address each of the three reported issues." - offers ongoing communication.

**8. Interpreting 3:** Further improved interpretation.

The email's tone is consistently positive and cooperative. The lack of any discussion regarding the legal basis for processing is a critical omission. The offer to provide updates is a good sign, but doesn't change the fact that the remediation is currently only planned. The "as soon as possible" and holiday season comments suggest a potential delay beyond the one-month deadline, but without a formal extension request, it's impossible to definitively say.

**9. Composing 3:** Third draft JSON object.

```json
{
  "extension_explicitly_requested": false,
  "extension_deadline": null,
  "extension_reasons": ["holidays"],
  "acknowledgement": "agree",
  "justification_explicit_article6_paragraph1_points": null,
  "justification_topics": ["account_management", "account_security"],
  "remediation_status": "planned",
  "remediation_scope": "unclear",
  "remediation_finish_date": null
}
```

**10. Discovering 4:** Final detailed quote extraction.

No new significant quotes are found. The email is quite concise and doesn't offer much beyond the initial assessment.

**11. Interpreting 4:** Final interpretation.

The email is a positive acknowledgement of the reported vulnerability. The sender is receptive and plans to address the issue, but provides no concrete timeline or details regarding the legal basis for the processing. The lack of a formal extension request, despite the potential for delay, is noteworthy. The overall impression is one of good faith, but insufficient detail to assess compliance with the GDPR request.

**12. Final JSON:**
